name: hArduino
tagline: Control your Arduino board from Haskell, using the Firmata protocol
body:
hArduino
==========

[![Build Status](https://travis-ci.org/LeventErkok/hArduino.png)](http://travis-ci.org/LeventErkok/hArduino)

While hArduino does not yet implement all of [Firmata](http://firmata.org) yet, it is mature enough to implement many interesting Arduino projects with. Some example programs:

   * Hello world: The standard led-blinking example: [Blink.hs]
(http://hackage.haskell.org/packages/archive/hArduino/latest/doc/html/System-Hardware-Arduino-SamplePrograms-Blink.html)
   * Controlling a digital switch: [Button.hs](http://hackage.haskell.org/packages/archive/hArduino/latest/doc/html/System-Hardware-Arduino-SamplePrograms-Button.html)
   * Implementing a counter via a pair of push-buttons: [Counter.hs](http://hackage.haskell.org/packages/archive/hArduino/latest/doc/html/System-Hardware-Arduino-SamplePrograms-Counter.html)
   * Reading an analog input value: [Analog.hs](http://hackage.haskell.org/packages/archive/hArduino/latest/doc/html/System-Hardware-Arduino-SamplePrograms-Analog.html)
   * Control an LCD display: [LCD.hs](http://hackage.haskell.org/packages/archive/hArduino/latest/doc/html/System-Hardware-Arduino-SamplePrograms-LCD.html)

There is a short [video](http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PPa3im44t2g) (4m29s) demonstrating the blink example.

You can explore the current API on Hackage: [hArduino](http://hackage.haskell.org/package/hArduino).

Patches, suggestions, and improvements are most welcome!

## Thanks
The following people reported bugs, provided comments/feedback, or contributed to the development of hArduino in various ways: Alexander Altman.
